title: Gulf Islands National Seashore: Eating & Sleeping
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Eating & Sleeping             Eating & Sleeping         Camping on Horn Island. NPS Photo  Eating      Limited food and beverage services, groceries, and convenience items are available in the Fort Pickens Area at the campground store year-round and at a snack bar near the fort during the summer.             Lodging There are no motels located within the national seashore. However, communities surrounding the park offer a wide choice of accommodations including hotels, bed and breakfasts, and campgrounds.             Camping The park offers several different types of camping options:  Primitive - primitive camping locations on barrier islands. Developed Campgrounds - RV and tent camping in a developed campground that has restrooms. Group Camping Sites - large frontcountry campsites suitable for groups.
